intro: Tricarpha purpusii, commonly known as the Mexican trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and its stems are often covered in fine, white hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Tricarpha purpusii is also valued for its ability to attract hummingbirds and other pollinators.
